title: Can't log-in to a site. Keep getting "BAD REQUEST" message
content:
I recently began having trouble logging into a retail web site that I have had an online account with for several years with no problems. One day, when I tried to log-in from the site's main page, I got nothing but a white screen with the following message:

Bad Request Your browser sent a request that this server could not understand. Size of a request header field exceeds server limit.

I tried the usual fixes: reboot my computer, re-set my password, etc. It called the site's tech support and they were mystified. They ended up deleting my account and sending me a special one-time activation code to set up a new account. But when I tried to set up a new account, I once again got the "Bad Request" message. I'm beginning to think it's a browser problem, but I can't say for sure. Any suggestions?

I should note that all of my other online logins are still working fine, and that I have made no recent changes in my computer hardware (I use a desktop) or peripherals. Any help you can give me would be greatly appreciated!
creator: mjz688

title: ESR Not updating Automatically in the background
content:
We are in an enterprise environment and for years we have had disabled automatic updates.

Firefox ESR 128.2.0 has been deployed with defaults and these settings have been configured to override previous settings.

Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > Mozilla > Firefox 

- Custom Update URL = Disabled - Disable Update = Disable - Application Autoupdate = Enabled - Background updater = Enabled

We also have a system proxy configured.

Updates do work if someone goes to Help > About Firefox.

Looks like the update interval is once every 7 hours but how is this triggered?
creator: bryan.c.lavalley.ctr

title: Options to delete files downloaded in Private mode or different download folder
content:
Hello,

The purpose of private mode is obvious from its name, then I wonder why Private mode uses the same download folder as the regular mode. It's not so private if files downloaded during Private mode go into an easily accessible and permanent folder. Following the logic of everything else in Private mode, there should be at least an option to have downloads go into a temp folder that gets deleted when leaving Private mode.

Why is there no way to select a download folder from Private mode that differs from the normal mode?

I don't follow this logic.

title: Decisões de Autenticação
content:
Bom dia Sempre que acesso o e-cac da Receita Federal pelo Firefox Mozilla, o titular da conta não muda. Aparece sempre o que foi acessado anteriormente em outro momento.

Para resolver o problema, fui inicialmente no HISTÓRICO e limpar o cache. Não deu resultado.

Em seguida fui em PRIVACIDADE E SEGURANÇA > CERTIFICADOS (ver certificados) GERENCIADOR DE CERTIFICADOS > DECISÕES DE AUTENTICAÇÃO > e exclui o certificado gravado nessa aba correspondente ao site que tenciono acessar. Essa solução permitiu o acesso desejado.

A questão é COMO ACESSAR A CONTA DESEJADA NO E-CAC SEM EXCLUIR O CERTIFICADO GRAVADO NA ABA DECISÕES DE AUTENTICAÇÃO?

Toda vez que eu for acessar o site citado com um certificado diferente eu vou ter que fazer os passos citados anteriormente? Não tem uma forma mais direta? Como não deixar gravado o certificado na aba Decisões de Autenticação?

Desde já agradeço a atenção.
creator: irapuan.barroso

title: Firefox immediately freezes on macOS
content:
Hi, since a few days Firefox basically became unusable on macOS.

Right now I can do the following: 1. Force quit Firefox 2. Open it again 3. Click Start New Session, do not restore anything 4. Go to this page for example: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/disable-or-re-enable-pocket-for-firefox 5. Baam, in a second or two Firefox is frozen. Only Force Quit works.

I tried removing the full profile, removing all folders in ~/Library which had Mozilla or Firefox in the name and making a new account. Still no change.

In the new profile I didn't enable any extensions. There are no crash reports in about:crash, I'm lost what should I do next?

Update: I downloaded Firefox ESR, currently version 128. It does the same! New profile, I go to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/disable-or-re-enable-pocket-for-firefox and it freezes.

I cannot even go to about:support!

title: Printing issue
content:
I want to print a PDF with a document size of about 4x2cm. When I choose "Default" Margins, the document is printed in the correct size, but without any margins. When I choose "Minimum" Margins, the document is printed with acceptable margins (12mm left, 4mm top), but the document is only printed in about 50% (or even less) size. Scale is set to 100 each (assuming those are percent) This is also visible in the print preview.

For the second printer, same issue (at least on print preview, didn't actually print) No issue (in print preview) when selecting "Microsoft Print to PDF" When choosing "OneNote (Desktop)" printer, the image is even smaller.

Tested around with custom margins a bit and it handles even worse. With my primary printer with 0.5 inches (defaults?) set, the size is ok but no margins are applied. Headers and footers are not shown (so the checkbox is checked - for some unknown reason) - Changing top margin to 0.49 or 0.51, the document is not shown, but the headers and footers are. Setting all margins to 0.00, both document and headers and footers are shown, but all overlapping / within the 4x2 document (paper size is set to Letter). Increasing the top margin (all others on 0.00) now makes the document shrink even more (Print preview, I didn't actually print)

title: Video Playback Issues on Specific Website with Firefox
content:
Hi there,

I’m encountering a strange issue when using Firefox to access videos on a particular website Patriot PDR. The site itself loads perfectly, but whenever I try to play any embedded videos or media on the page, the video either doesn’t load or remains stuck buffering.

Interestingly, I’ve tested the same website and videos on other browsers like Chrome and Edge, and they work flawlessly. I’ve already tried clearing the cache, disabling hardware acceleration, and running Firefox in Safe Mode, but the problem persists only on Firefox.

Could this be a compatibility issue between Firefox and the way the media is embedded on this specific site? I would appreciate any suggestions to resolve this problem.

Thanks for your help!
creator: its.jacobtaylor55
